abstract.p: Orange PLC, British mobile phone service operator, acquires sophisticated digital animated character called Ananova and its supporting software for $143.8 million from Press Association, British domestic news agency; Ananova acts as virtual newscaster with wide range of expressions, voice intonations and body movements; Orange's chief Hans Snook comments; photo (S)

block.p: The British mobile phone service operator, Orange P.L.C., which France Telecom S.A. is acquiring, has acquired a sophisticated digitally animated character called Ananova and its supporting software for $143.8 million from the Press Association, the British domestic news agency. Ananova acts as a virtual newscaster with a range of expressions, voice intonations and body movements. Hans Snook, Orange's chief executive, said the character and the software would be used in Orange's new-media operations, which he said would take ''wirefree communications beyond what is available today.''
